channel.title: Needing help with connecting to my server
channel.description:
So a while back i had a older linksys router that I was able to port forward on but that kicked the can so I went out and bought a Netgear R6300 which I figured out how to port forward on and it worked for some time but randomly it wouldn't let anyone connect to my server and I've searched all around to find a fix and I simply cant. The ip I was using was the one ipchicken.com told me. I just need a fix for it as I haven't played with my friends on my server in months because of this. I would really appreciate any ideas or help. Also, I tried turning off my firewall and that had no success. Any ideas help.
Thanks :)

item.title: Needing help with connecting to my server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Chiller:

I’ve done that tons of times haha. I don’t know whether its my router’s firewall possibly? I tried it on another computer with the same result so I believe it’s my router.

How are you checking?

Read full topic

item.title: Needing help with connecting to my server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Chiller:

I always checked what my local IP was and made sure that it was correct in my router. But just a heads up I am doing exactly what it says on portforward.com and what I have always done. Would anyone recommend that I just make my router go back to factory settings?

Just re-portforward.

Read full topic
